intro: Verbascum eriocarpum, commonly known as the woolly mullein, is a perennial plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, gray-green leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces showy yellow flowers in late summer, which are clustered in a spike at the top of the stem. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Verbascum eriocarpum is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, known for its medicinal and ornamental uses.
